abstract.text: Construction contract is one of the steps of the construction process.
In order to conclude acceptable and thoughtout construction contracts, effective methodologies for their evaluation and comparison must be developed.
In order to solve various legal problems, electronic legal decision support systems have been developed in the world.

Application of the electronic legal decision support systems can help to navigate in the legal system easier, makes additional reading of legal acts redundant, creates opportunities to analyse decision variants and to select the most favourable one, provides users with the newest and most extensive information, enables quick search and can use classification and information transfer features.
In order to conclude acceptable and well-thought construction contraction agreements, effective methodologies for their evaluation and comparison must be developed.

In order to prepare such methodologies, it is necessary to analyse not only technical, organisational and economic aspects in construction but also legal aspects of a construction contraction agreement.
Management of construction works includes conclusion of contracts between the client and the contractor.
Contract making has great influence on economic success of both parties, on their behaviour in order to increase their profit and it can protect against possible loss.
This article analyses construction contraction agreements by providing a model of construction contraction agreement provisions based on their functions.
Construction contraction agreements should be concluded, evaluated and compared on the basis of this model.
Values of indicators are determined and a multiple criteria decision support system is developed on the basis of this model.

body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Decision-making is a very important stage in the construction process as in life of every person; it determines the future of the person or of construction works.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: For example, when preparing a construction contraction agreement, hundreds of decisions must be made: the larger the project, the bigger the number of various level decisions.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Those who prepare a construction contraction agreement must be knowledgeable about provisions of laws, the requirements of parties, possible variants of risk transfer, etc.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Conclusion of a CCA is one of the components of the construction process.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: In order to conclude a proper CCA, it is necessary to analyse agreement provisions properly and to consider their characteristics.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: It is very important to properly evaluate CCA provisions, such as contractor's liabilities, provided guarantees, client's liabilities, provisions for contract termination and suspension, etc.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: This stage is related to certain decision-making.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: One of the most important contract elements is the contents of the agreement, which consists of the entire system of agreement provisions.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Contract provisions are determined on the basis of one of the main principles of the civil law: the principle of contract freedom.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Contract provisions determine rights and duties of the parties, i.e. their certain behaviour.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: In practice, it is important to formulate exact agreement provisions, because they determine peculiarities of rights and duties related to liabilities and their proper implementation.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: The system of CCA provisions may be also modelled considering the functions of agreement provisions.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: All CCA provisions have a certain function.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: For example, agreement provisions regulating guarantees, surety or forfeit have the function of liability guarantee.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: All provisions regulating the aforementioned function may be joined to a separate subsystem.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Similarly, other agreement provisions may also be joined to subsystems.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Following the aforementioned principle, a hierarchical model of CCA provisions based on their functions has been made and provided in Fig. 1.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: While considering functions of agreement provisions they are joined to groups or, in other words, to subsystems.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: In their turn subsystems according to their functions are grouped into systems of higher level.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: At the end of the process, the highest point of the system of agreement provisions is reached, which coincides with the aim of the decision-making process.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Thus the aim is specified at the first level of the hierarchy, i.e. the construction contraction agreement.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: The second level of hierarchy consists of criteria which make immediate influence on the final goal.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: At the same time each criterion is at the top of the created hierarchy, connecting to its top.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: The third level consists of criteria determined by the second level.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Hierarchical structures are developed on the basis of transfer of authorisation, i.e. on the basis of subordination.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Therefore, they cannot include horizontal relationships.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Such relationships reflect not subordination but coordination [11].
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Using an expert method, provisions have been determined which influence construction contract contents:
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: • performance of construction works according to the contract and following the requirements specified in normative documents of construction; When CCA contents are divided into separate provisions, which influence smooth construction process, we get a model ( Fig. 1), which is broadly applicable in CCA preparation.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: It is possible to distinguish the following advantages of a hierarchical structure:
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: • hierarchical structure may be used to describe how lower level priorities influence the change of higher level priorities; • hierarchy provides considerably more detailed information about lower level structures, functions and their influence on higher levels; • when systems reflecting real situation are developed by means of hierarchy, i.e. by developing and later uniting models, their development is more effective than in cases when the system is made at once; • a hierarchical system is both stable and flexible.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Stability means that slight modifications in the hierarchy cause very small changes.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Flexibility means that introduction of several new criteria does not change the essence of a well-developed hierarchy.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: The used hierarchy has its own specific features, therefore, the following presumptions are offered for use [10] to the value of one indicator of a higher level, i.e. to one;

body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: In order to evaluate CCAs and compare their different variants, it is not enough only to develop a model of agreement provisions.
body_text.section: Model of the System of CCA Provisions

body_text.text: Striving to the aforementioned aims, it is necessary to determine the significance of structural elements of the developed model, i.e. of agreement provisions and groups of agreement provisions (model subsystems).

body_text.text: Classic civil law considers a contract as a result of expression of two wills.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: If the will is not present or is faulty, the main element of a contract is missing.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: Nobody can be bound by a contract against his/her will.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: Should the modern law know only these features of contract making, it would become a serious barrier to validate contracts concluded by e-agents, which may be controlled by a third party (e.g. e-shop).
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: However, both general law and civil law are rather rapidly developing legal systems, thus issues related to liability outcomes of contractual will expression, errors and consent provided by a more obvious agent are evaluated broadly by underlining the reliability of the other party and not the identification of an independent will expression.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: Sometimes negligent actions of a party are used as a basis, for example, a party was negligent in selection of contract phrases and was not attentive enough to remove the circumstances because of which somebody was considered its representative.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: Sometimes it is made objective by an opinion that parties accept responsibility for the selected means of contract conclusion.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: The general validity of contracts concluded by e-agents is a fictitious problem initiated by suspicions caused by outdated civil and commercial law, often resultant from nonlawyers and stereotypic understanding of the will of contract parties.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: There is a considerably strong basis to claim that nobody can be exempt from an obligation to fulfil a contract only because an e-agent was an intermediary in its conclusion.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: The problem is related to settlement of errors made by e-agents.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: Another problem is related to a question whether it is allowed to exempt a party from liabilities under a contract if it proves that the error occurred due to technical problems of an e-agent.

body_text.text: On the basis of the aforementioned provisions, a model of the Web-based Decision Support System for Construction Contract Preparation was developed.

body_text.text: This model can help to implement the functional model of the system of construction contract provisions developed by the authors and other principle elements.
body_text.section: Possibilities to implement the hierarchical model in decision support systems

body_text.text: 1. Currently, multiple criteria methods and models are offered for efficiency improvement when solving various issues related to construction; however, preparation, evaluation and comparison of CCAs is still rather disregarded.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: In order that the construction process is effective and smooth, the CCA must be properly prepared.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: In order to solve this task successfully, a model of the system of CCA provisions has been created.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: The model is based on functions of provisions.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: 2. The model of CCA provisions based on their functions is convenient to determine significance of agreement provisions.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: Then it is possible to develop an Internet-based legal CCA decision support system.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: Such conclusion can be made for the following reasons: first, experts can easier evaluate significance of agreement provisions grouped according to their functions and, second, legal power of all CCA provisions is equal, irrespective of the group they are attributed to according to any of the analysed classifications.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: However, the latter classification illustrates real operation of a CCA and its functions best.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: 3. Three CCAs have been selected for calculations and evaluation provided as an example.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: The evaluation has shown that the first variant is the most favourable to a client, and having analysed graphic information, it is possible to determine possibilities for improvement of agreements.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: Software Expert Choice, which has been used in this process, is well adjusted to development of a good hierarchy, to determination of criteria significance, to evaluation and analysis of the evaluation results.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: 4. The calculations provided as an example enable the following conclusion: although the aforementioned software has a number of advantages, several main disadvantages can also be distinguished.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: The software is designed for stationary workstations.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: Thus the developed hierarchical model of CCA evaluation criteria can be only an extramodule of the aforementioned software.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: Whereas users who do not have specialised software cannot use the developed system of criteria.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: Although the system foresees a possibility to place hierarchy models in the Internet, only Expert Choice software users can use them to full extent.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: Considering the results of the analysis, a specialised decision support system should be developed for CCA evaluation; the system would implement advantages of an Internet-based system.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: 5. Since computer and information technologies are developing constantly, it is very important to foresee the possibilities to improve a decision support system.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: The vital task is to increase system's integration considering the trends of development of the aforementioned technologies and the purpose of a decision support system.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: This way a user can use the developed system without special training or with the minimum training, the need for additional soft-ware is lower, requirements to hardware are reduced, new and better conditions for electronic exchange of data are created and more functions (video conferencing, video and audio records, contract signing by electronic means, etc.) related to preparation of construction contracts become integrated.
